TempSED 0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Forcings, initial conditions, and sediment data from the Oosterschelde in 2020

    TempSED_data.Rd

    Data set ForcingOS contains hourly data for meteorological conditions and for water column properties for 2020; HRforcingOS contains water height and water temperature data with 10-minute resolution for 2020.

    The data were obtained from:

    • Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute KNMI (WindSpeed, AirTemperature, Cloudiness, SolarRadiation, Pressure, AirHumidity), their station 315, Vlissingen.

    • from Rijkswaterstaat (waterHeight), from the mooring at Stavenisse

    • Royal Netherlands Institute for Sea Research NIOZ (WaterTemperature): the Yersekse paal, in the center of the Oosterschelde.

    The dataset contains:

    • Time, Second: the time in long format and in seconds. The KNMI data were obtained at hourly intervals; the other data (WaterTemperature, WaterHeight) were at 10 minute intervals. These data are in data set HRforcingOS. The values at the start of the day are also in ForcingOS

    • Windspeed, speed of the wind at 10 m above the surface [m/s]

    • Airtemperature, Watertemperature, [dgC]

    • Dewpoint, dewpoint air Temperature, [dgC]

    • Cloudiness, fractional cover of the sky by clouds [-]).

    • Solarradiation, solar radiation [W/m2].

    • Airhumidity, water vapor as a fraction of saturated water vapor [-].

    • Pressure [Pa].

    • Rain [cm/hour]

    • Waterheight, water height above NAP (nieuw Amsterdams Peil) [m].

    Data set DataOS contains sediment temperature data from Zandkreek in the Oosterschelde, at 3 cm deep. Data from NIOZ. It contains:

    • Time: the time in long format and in seconds, [Second].

    • SedimentTemperature, [dgC]

    • Depth_cm, the depth at which the temperature was recorded [cm]

    InitTempOS contains initial conditions to run the Oosterschelde model.

    ForcingOS
DataOS

    Format

    ForcingOS is a data.frame with 8784 rows and 10 columns;

    DataOS is a data.frame with 9898 rows and 4 columns.

    Author

    Karline Soetaert <karline.soetaert@nioz.nl>

    Examples

    summary(ForcingOS)
#>       Time                            Second         Watertemperature
#>  Min.   :2020-01-01 00:00:00.00   Min.   :       0   Min.   : 5.175  
#>  1st Qu.:2020-04-01 12:45:00.00   1st Qu.: 7904700   1st Qu.: 7.301  
#>  Median :2020-07-02 00:30:00.00   Median :15809400   Median :12.669  
#>  Mean   :2020-07-02 00:41:08.02   Mean   :15809400   Mean   :13.073  
#>  3rd Qu.:2020-10-01 12:15:00.00   3rd Qu.:23714100   3rd Qu.:18.701  
#>  Max.   :2021-01-01 00:00:00.00   Max.   :31618800   Max.   :25.417  
#>                                                      NA's   :105     
#>   Waterheight         Windspeed     Airtemperature     Dewpoint     
#>  Min.   :-2.21000   Min.   : 0.00   Min.   : 0.50   Min.   :-8.500  
#>  1st Qu.:-0.87000   1st Qu.: 4.00   1st Qu.: 8.10   1st Qu.: 4.700  
#>  Median :-0.01000   Median : 6.00   Median :11.70   Median : 8.100  
#>  Mean   : 0.07705   Mean   : 6.69   Mean   :12.41   Mean   : 8.263  
#>  3rd Qu.: 1.05000   3rd Qu.: 9.00   3rd Qu.:16.60   3rd Qu.:11.800  
#>  Max.   : 2.83000   Max.   :24.00   Max.   :33.30   Max.   :21.600  
#>  NA's   :25                                                         
#>    Cloudiness     Solarradiation       Pressure       Airhumidity    
#>  Min.   :0.0000   Min.   :  0.000   Min.   : 973.7   Min.   :0.2400  
#>  1st Qu.:0.3750   1st Qu.:  0.000   1st Qu.:1009.2   1st Qu.:0.6800  
#>  Median :1.0000   Median :  5.556   Median :1016.3   Median :0.8000  
#>  Mean   :0.7084   Mean   :139.476   Mean   :1015.1   Mean   :0.7697  
#>  3rd Qu.:1.0000   3rd Qu.:194.444   3rd Qu.:1021.8   3rd Qu.:0.8800  
#>  Max.   :1.0000   Max.   :916.667   Max.   :1048.6   Max.   :1.0000  
#>                                                                      
#>       Rain          
#>  Min.   :-0.010000  
#>  1st Qu.: 0.000000  
#>  Median : 0.000000  
#>  Mean   : 0.007944  
#>  3rd Qu.: 0.000000  
#>  Max.   : 5.130000  
#>                     
plot(ForcingOS[, 1:2], type = "l")

attributes(ForcingOS)$description
#>               names   units                                         description
#> 1              Time    time                                 time in long format
#> 2            Second     sec                                     time in seconds
#> 3  Watertemperature     dgC                            temperature of the water
#> 4       Waterheight       m                           height of water above NAP
#> 5         Windspeed     m/s                  wind speed, 10 m above the surface
#> 6    Airtemperature     dgC                              temperature of the air
#> 7          Dewpoint     dgC                            dewpoint air temperature
#> 8        Cloudiness       -               fractional cover of the sky by clouds
#> 9    Solarradiation    W/m2                                     solar radiation
#> 10         Pressure      Pa                                        air pressure
#> 11      Airhumidity       -  water vapor as a fraction of saturated water vapor
#> 12             Rain cm/hour                                           rain rate

head(DataOS)
#>                  Time   Second SedimentTemperature Depth_cm
#> 1 2020-06-10 14:00:00 13957200              22.780        3
#> 2 2020-06-10 14:15:00 13958100              22.135        3
#> 3 2020-06-10 14:30:00 13959000              21.685        3
#> 4 2020-06-10 14:45:00 13959900              21.510        3
#> 5 2020-06-10 15:00:00 13960800              21.085        3
#> 6 2020-06-10 15:15:00 13961700              20.585        3

# use forcing function in model
 times <- seq(from = as.POSIXct("2020-01-01"),
              to   = as.POSIXct("2020-04-01"),
              by   = 3600)
 Tout <- TempSED_run1D(
      T_ini            = 10, 
      times            = as.numeric(times), 
      f_Airtemperature = ForcingOS[, c("Time", "Airtemperature")],
      f_Solarradiation = ForcingOS[, c("Time", "Solarradiation")])

# initial condition
plot(InitTempOS[, 2:1], ylim = c(10,0), 
     main = "InitTempOS", ylab = "depth, m", xlab = "Temperature")
